CatDescriptText: Mary Ann Daransky, high school student, Uptown, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I don't think I would be qualified to talk to him. Also, there's been so much said about the bomb that he already knows how the people of the world feel towards him."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ann Daransky wearing dark coat with single large button at neck, standing next to Barbara Glenn, posed in front of building with advertisement for dog food, Downtown
